cyclone.name: ZETA
cyclone.current_location: about 90 mi (145 km) southeast of Cozumel, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: Moving northwest across the Yucatan Peninsula, then turning north-northeast over the Gulf of Mexico toward the northern Gulf Coast (southeast Louisiana–Mississippi).
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeast Louisiana coastline (near Morgan City–Port Fourchon area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch: Morgan City LA to the MS/AL border; Storm Surge Watch: Intracoastal City LA to Navarre FL
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane and Tropical-Storm Warnings in effect only for the Yucatan Peninsula of Mexico (none yet for U.S. coast)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from southeast Louisiana to the western Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: Only minimal tropical-storm-force gusts possible; most likely winds 15–25 mph with higher gusts if outer bands brush the area.
weather_observation.storm_surge: No significant storm-surge inundation expected along the Sabine-Neches waterway.
weather_observation.rainfall: Light to moderate rain bands possible (generally 1–2 inches).
weather_observation.other_hazards: None anticipated that would significantly disrupt port operations.
